intro: Saussurea tilesii var. glabriuscula, commonly known as the Tibetan gentian, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant is adapted to cold, arid environments and often grows in rocky or alpine habitats. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered with a fine, short pubescence. This variant is distinguished by its reduced hair coverage compared to other varieties of Saussurea tilesii.
